title: error[6275]: ParserError:
body:
So I am trying to deploy a contract using foundry-rs. So far everything is looking good, but right when I began to compile I run into an error (full error listed below).

I have made sure to source .env before forging
I have also made sure to double check my paths and echoed to my .env 


---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**Compiler run failed
error[6275]: ParserError: Source "lib/openzeppelin-contracts/certora/munged/token/ERC20/extensions/ERC20Votes.sol" not found: File not found. Searched the following locations: "/Users/justinzarate/hello_foundry", "/Users/justinzarate/hello_foundry/script", "/Users/justinzarate/hello_foundry/test".

1 | import "../munged/token/ERC20/extensions/ERC20Votes.sol";

Can you share a link to a repository or describe your setup in more detail? What is in your lib directory, etc.

> 

https://github.com/justinzarate/hello_foundry/tree/master/lib


I am currently experiencing this problem on two different devices (MACOS) and a brand new LINUX VM (running on windows)

Can you try setting `src = 'src'` in your config? I believe this may be causing the problem. This is the recommended configuration I get from `forge init`.

https://github.com/justinzarate/hello_foundry/blob/b916ae0ee2b2b4fefc6f4782a650ac4a6a3f0988/foundry.toml#L2

> Can you try setting `src = 'src'` in your config? I believe this may be causing the problem. This is the recommended configuration I get from `forge init`.
> 
> https://github.com/justinzarate/hello_foundry/blob/b916ae0ee2b2b4fefc6f4782a650ac4a6a3f0988/foundry.toml#L2

Worked! Thanks. You're amazing. Sending you good energy my friend.
